scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica and Bob still seem unconvinced. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'I just don't see how this is going to work.' Bob looks at you, exasperated, 'Are we really going to keep pushing everyone this hard?' You suggested reassessing the approach and redistributing the tasks. Monica and Bob are now discussing the new plan with you. Monica sighs and says, 'Even with the new plan, I'm not sure everyone will be on board.'
scenes.description: Bob, looking a bit more hopeful but still skeptical, asks, 'What if some team members just can't handle the pressure?'

options.text: We need to identify who might be struggling and offer them support. Let's check in with everyone individually.
options.analysis: You showed strong empathy and social skills by suggesting individual check-ins, though the focus on emotional perception and self-regulation could be balanced better.

options.text: It's a challenging situation, but if we communicate effectively and support each other, we can manage it.
options.analysis: You emphasized communication and mutual support, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If someone can't handle the pressure, they need to speak up now. We have no choice but to push through.
options.analysis: You pushed for transparency and action, showing moderate social skills and motivation, though empathy and emotional perception were less emphasized.
